data.enText: the fact of stopping work because you have reached a particular age; the time when you do this
At 60, he was now approaching retirement.
Susan is going to take early retirement (= retire before the usual age) .
the period of your life after you have stopped work at a particular age

data.chText: 我们大家祝愿你的退休生活长久而幸福。
data.enText: We all wish you a long and happy retirement.

data.chText: 现在人们一生中能有三分之一的时间过退休生活。
data.enText: Up to a third of one's life is now being spent in retirement .

data.chText: （尤指从体育、政治等方面的）退出，引退，退职
data.enText: the act of stopping a particular type of work, especially in sport, politics, etc.
He announced his retirement from football.

data.chText: 她复出后在锦标赛上赢得了两枚金牌。
data.enText: She came out of retirement to win two gold medals at the championships.

means: (尤指从体育、政治等方面的)退出，引退

tr: withdrawal for prayer and study and meditation
example: the religious retreat is a form of vacation activity

tr: withdrawal from your position or occupation
the state of being retired from one's business or occupation

value.def: Retirement is the time when a worker retires.

example.ex: ...the proportion of the population who are over retirement age...
example.tran: 超过退休年龄的人口比例

example.ex: The Governor of the prison and another official are to take early retirement.
example.tran: 这个监狱的监狱长和另外一个官员将会提前退休。

value.def: A person's retirement is the period in their life after they have retired.

example.ex: ...financial support for the elderly during retirement.
example.tran: 为退休期间的老年人提供的经济支持

trans: 退休年齡；退休年龄；定年
提前退休；早退休；提前退职；提早退休；早退休人员
退休计划；退休金计划；养老金计划；退休打算；退休计画
退休社区；退休人员社区；退休者社区
退休金；养老金；退休年金；退休养老金；退休养老金领取额
退休收入；退休金；退休所得
退休金；退休基金；养老保险；养老金
